channel.title: New DVD/CD drive
channel.description:
i want to replace my laptop's internal dvd drive. are there any prerequisites i should look for when buying the drive so that it is compatible with my laptop? what kind of drives will [b]not[/b] be compatible on my laptop?
as for the actual replacing, is it really as simple as removing my current drive and just shoving in the new one?
[url=http://www.notebookcheck.net/Review-Dell-Vostro-1000-Notebook.6545.0.html]this[/url] is my laptop

item.title: New DVD/CD drive
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’m so lost right now. First he said he wanted to replace his DVD drive, now you’re talking about Hard Drives???

http://cgi.ebay.com/Dell-VOSTRO-1000-DVDRW-CD-DVD-RW-Burner-Writer-Drive-8X_W0QQitemZ390094133270QQcmdZViewItemQQptZPCC_Drives_Storage_Internal?hash=item5ad36c1816

Read full topic

item.title: New DVD/CD drive
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:307275”]By size he meant 2.5" 3.5" etc.

Also from googling it appears your current drive is ATA, so no SATA for you.[/quote]
ATAPI, more specifically. (So anything with IDE, ATA will work)
But it is best if you bought a dell IDE drive so it actually fits in your laptop.

Anyway the HDD is SATA: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822116024

Read full topic

item.title: New DVD/CD drive
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

By size he meant 2.5" 3.5" etc.

Also from googling it appears your current drive is ATA, so no SATA for you.

Read full topic

item.title: New DVD/CD drive
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:4, topic:307275”]check the HDD size of your laptop and check the manual for requirements

most likely you just need a 2.5" drive with SATA[/quote]120GB, but what does hdd size have to do with replacing my internal dvd drive?

anyways how do i know if my drive has SATA?

Read full topic

item.description:

most likely you just need a 2.5" drive with SATA
